meanings.sent1: The ribaldest puppy in the litter was always causing chaos.
meanings.sent2: The children had a ribaldest time playing tag in the park.
meanings.sent3: The ribaldest squirrel in the tree kept stealing nuts from the others.
meanings.sent4: The ribaldest storm of the season knocked down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent5: The ribaldest waves crashed against the shore during the hurricane.

meanings.definition: the most mischievous or troublemaking person
meanings.sent1: Tommy was known as the ribaldest in the neighborhood for his pranks.
meanings.sent2: The ribaldest in the class always had a new scheme up their sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The ribaldest at the office put a whoopee cushion on the boss's chair.
meanings.sent4: The ribaldest of the group convinced everyone to skip school.
meanings.sent5: The ribaldest at the party started a food fight that lasted for hours.

meanings.definition: in the most rowdy or disruptive manner
meanings.sent1: The kids were running ribaldest around the playground.
meanings.sent2: The fans cheered ribaldest for their favorite team at the game.
meanings.sent3: The music blared ribaldest from the speakers, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The protesters marched ribaldest through the streets, demanding change.
meanings.sent5: The students laughed ribaldest during the comedy show, causing a scene.
